title: Cognitive Load Management Strategies for Improving Online Language Lecture Quality

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic language skills (reading/writing/speaking), experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Interactive environment utilizing real-time video conferencing tools, where learners may have varying device and network conditions

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more cognitive load theory (CLT)-based strategies when designing online lectures.
Learners can explain five or more design principles to reduce extraneous cognitive load in language learning content.
Learners achieve over 80% suitability in actual language instructional design by utilizing quality assessment rubrics during project-based evaluations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
